title: How did i not get an A- or an S ?
body:
So I was the {{champion:555}}  in the game in the link and i just want to know why no match rating was given. I need one more mastery 7 token to get him to mastery 7 but I received no rating for that match not even a D- and it sucks. was it because it was my first game of the day or something im just really confused. I am 15/2/7, most kills in the game, highest gold generated, highest vision score and the game was 35:43 minutes long.

Riot, Please Explain

replies.body: Your grade is announced in chat in the post-game lobby, but if you don't mouse over your champion's portrait to show your grade there before leaving that lobby, it doesn't get saved to your match history.

Highest vision score is relative. You are not graded against your teammates, you are graded relative to other Pykes. So you also have to realize he is popular currently so the pool is much larger, and therefore the bar to earn S etc is much more challenging. Play a support nobody plays and watch as you get an S+ going 1/0/8.

> [{quoted}](name=Failmageddon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LMb7Iw1p,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-09-25T05:57:00.931+0000)
>
> Highest vision score is relative. You are not graded against your teammates, you are graded relative to other Pykes. So you also have to realize he is popular currently so the pool is much larger, and therefore the bar to earn S etc is much more challenging. Play a support nobody plays and watch as you get an S+ going 1/0/8.

He had a good vision score, it was something like 2/m...

That doesn't mean that a rating wasn't given. Only the rating gets lost in the history a percentage of the time, especially if you leave the lobby quickly. If you had earned an S, then you would have received a token.

Numbers look pretty good to me, though. Perhaps you received S-.

I've never tried doing this, but I suppose that it is possible, that if you made a ticket or a bug report, then your grade could be retrieved. However, if it had been an S, then a token would already have been granted.

Another possibility, is that supports are disproportionately graded on a curve towards assists (not kills).
